result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • John A. Alloway was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Commencing on date of valid driver's license and must be installed in any vehicle operated by defendant and any vehicle registered or titled in his name.

miscConds.notes: No consumption or possession of alcohol.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week.

timeConds.notes: Huber, good time allowed and eligable for community service under 973.09.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John A. Alloway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John A. Alloway in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:22 pm. Have resolution - State - has provided 2 options. Arbuckle has provided the court with PLQ. State - Count 1 - 2 year probation. Count 2 dismissed. 140 days FC jail, fine of $2362, 28 month DL revocation, AODA, IID and any other conditions set forth by court. Court dismisses count 2. Alloway pleads NC to count one. Court goes over form with defendant and finds he is entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea and waiving his constitutional right to trial, court finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. Alloway admits to 3 prior convictions. State makes final statement. Arbuckle makes final statement. Alloway makes statement, remorseful. Court will accept recommendation and sentences to the following: Count 1 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of conditional jail time of 140 days in FC jail, huber and good time allowed, community service under 973.09, imposes fine of $2362, revoke DL for 28 months, IID for period of 28 months commencing on date of valid DL -  must be installed in any vehicle operated by defendant and any vehicle registered or titled in his name, AODA and follow through with any recommendations, no consumption or possession of alcohol, must attend one AA/NA or similar meeting per week, must submit DNA sample, report to jail today, sign up for probation today. Exhibit #1 provided by State will be received by the court. Arbuckle questions IID requirement. Arbuckle requests fine to be paid over probation and bond posted be returned to poster. Court must apply bond, remainder will be refunded to poster. Appeal rights given. 2 days jail credit, stipulated.

Defendant John A. Alloway in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:17 AM. Arbuckle informs Court why the defendant was not here on the original court date - confused with court date on citation that he received, requests Court to quash the warrant and reinstate the $2500 cash bond that is already posted. State - no objections. Court will quash the warrant, reinstates cash bond of $2500.00 that is already posted. Arbuckle has complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant John A. Alloway not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:35 AM. State moves to forfeit any bond posted and bench warrant, body or money greater than bond posted. Court forfeits bond, issues bench warrant, bod or $3000.00
